title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Does Attendance Impact Team Performance in the MLB
text:
blog post goes here

library(tidyverse)
library(scales)
library(ggrepel)
attendance <- read_csv("attendance21-22.csv")
standings <- read_csv("mlbstandings2022.csv")
teaminfo <- read_csv("mlbteaminfo.csv")
combined <- attendance %>% inner_join(standings, by="Tm")

combinedinfo<- combined%>% inner_join(teaminfo, by="Tm")

OAK<- combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W < 70) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` < 800000)

MIA<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W < 70) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 907487)

LAD<- combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W > 105) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` > 3500000)

CLE <- combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W > 90) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` < 2000000)

TBR<- combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W > 84) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 1128127)

STL<- combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W > 92) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 3320551)

HOU<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W == 106) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` > 2000000)

NYY<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W == 99) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 3136207)

PHI<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W == 87) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 2276736)

PIT<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W == 62) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 1257458)

WSN<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W == 55) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 2026401)

twentytwoAtt<- attendance %>% 
  arrange(desc('2022 Att')) %>% 
  select(Tm, `2022 Att`)

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=attendance, aes(x=reorder(Tm, `2022 Att`), weight= `2022 Att`), fill = "light grey") +
  geom_bar(data=CLE, aes(x=reorder(Tm, `2022 Att`), weight= `2022 Att`), fill="#00385D") +
  geom_bar(data=HOU, aes(x=reorder(Tm, `2022 Att`), weight= `2022 Att`), fill="#EB6E1F") +
  geom_bar(data=PHI, aes(x=reorder(Tm, `2022 Att`), weight= `2022 Att`), fill="#E81828") +
  geom_text(aes(x=25, y=3390000, label="Houston won the world series"), color="black") +
  geom_text(aes(x=15, y=3050000, label="Philly made it to the world series"), color="black") +
  geom_text(aes(x=6, y=2500000, label="Cleveland won 92 games and finished 7th overall"), color="black") +
  geom_text(aes(x=20, y=280000, label="<<League Average Attendance"), color="blue") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 2151889, color="blue")+ 
  scale_y_continuous(labels=comma)+
  coord_flip()+
  labs(
    x="Team", 
    y="2022 Overall Attendance", 
    title="2022 MLB Average Attendance vs Individual Team Attendance", 
    subtitle="How MLB an teams 2022 season attendance compares to the league average.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | By Tenley Wright"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 17, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 12), 
    axis.text.y=element_text(size = 8),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=14), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 




more blog post here

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(data=combined, aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W)) +
  geom_smooth(data=combined, aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), method="lm", se=FALSE)+
  scale_x_continuous(labels=comma)+
  geom_point(
    data=OAK, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#EFB21E") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=OAK, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=MIA, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#00A3E0") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=MIA, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=LAD, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#005A9C") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=LAD, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-20000, y=W+3, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=CLE, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#E50022") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=CLE, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W+.5, label=Tm))+
    geom_point(
    data=TBR, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#8FBCE6") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=TBR, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-800, y=W-2, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=STL, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#C41E3A") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=STL, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
   geom_point(
    data=HOU, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#EB6E1F") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=HOU, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`+409, y=W+1, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=PHI, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#E81828") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=PHI, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=WSN, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#AB0003") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=WSN, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W+2, label=Tm))+
labs(
    x="Attendance", 
    y="Wins", 
    title="The impact of Attendance on Performace in MLB", 
    subtitle="Attendance had little effect on a teams ability to win games.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | By Tenley Wright"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 12), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=15), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 




more blog post here

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=combinedinfo, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`), 
    color="#5c5c5c", 
    alpha=.3) + 
  scale_x_continuous(labels=comma)+
  scale_size_continuous(labels=comma)+
  geom_point(
  data=OAK, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`), 
    color= "#EFB21E",
     alpha=.3) +
  geom_text_repel(
  data=OAK, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=MIA, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`), 
    color= "#00A3E0",
    alpha=.3) +
  geom_text_repel(
  data=MIA, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=LAD, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`), 
    color= "#005A9C",
       alpha=.29) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=LAD, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-20000, y=W+3, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=CLE, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#E50022",
     alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=CLE, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W+.5, label=Tm))+
    geom_point(
    data=TBR, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#8FBCE6",
     alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=TBR, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-800, y=W-2, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=STL, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`), 
    color= "#C41E3A",
     alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=STL, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
   geom_point(
    data=HOU, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#EB6E1F",
     alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=HOU, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-500, y=W+2, label=Tm))+
     geom_point(
    data=PHI, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#E81828",
    alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=PHI, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-50000, y=W+.5, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=PIT, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#FDB827",
    alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=PIT, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W-.5, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=WSN, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#AB0003",
    alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=WSN, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-50000, y=W+2, label=Tm))+
  labs(
    x="Season Attendance", 
    y="Wins", 
    title="The impact of Payroll on Attendance and Performance", 
    subtitle="In 2022, teams with a higher payroll were winning more and drawing more fans to their games.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | By Tenley Wright"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 14), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=12), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    legend.position="right"
    ) 




more blog post here

title: About Tenley Wright
text: Tenley is a sophomore at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln, where she studies Sports Media and Communications with a minor in Art History. When she’s not in class, she works for the Husker Athletics department as a Creative Media intern. She has a passion for Action photography and is working towards a future career in Sports media, hopefully working with the MLB, PGA or NCAA.

title: Tenley Wright's Blog
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.4.0      ✔ purrr   1.0.1 
✔ tibble  3.2.1      ✔ dplyr   1.0.10
✔ tidyr   1.2.1      ✔ stringr 1.5.0 
✔ readr   2.1.3      ✔ forcats 0.5.2 
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()

library(scales)


Attaching package: 'scales'

The following object is masked from 'package:purrr':

    discard

The following object is masked from 'package:readr':

    col_factor

library(ggrepel)
attendance <- read_csv("attendance21-22.csv")

Rows: 30 Columns: 10
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Tm
dbl (9): Rk, 2021 G, 2021 Attendance, 2021 Attend/G, 2022 G, 2022 Att, 2022 ...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

standings <- read_csv("mlbstandings2022.csv")

Rows: 30 Columns: 29
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (19): Team, Strk, pythWL, vEast, vCent, vWest, Inter, Home, Road, ExInn,...
dbl (10): Rk, W, L, W-L%, R, RA, Rdiff, SOS, SRS, Luck

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

teaminfo <- read_csv("mlbteaminfo.csv")

Rows: 30 Columns: 17
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr   (4): Team, Succ%, Managers, Tm
dbl  (12): Attendance, Attend/G, BatAge, PAge, BPF, PPF, #HOF, #A-S, #a-tA-S...
time  (1): Time

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

combined <- attendance %>% inner_join(standings, by="Tm")

combinedinfo<- combined%>% inner_join(teaminfo, by="Tm")

Team data frames

OAK<- combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W < 70) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` < 800000)

MIA<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W < 70) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 907487)

LAD<- combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W > 105) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` > 3500000)

CLE <- combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W > 90) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` < 2000000)

TBR<- combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W > 84) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 1128127)

STL<- combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W > 92) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 3320551)

HOU<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W == 106) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` > 2000000)

NYY<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W == 99) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 3136207)

PHI<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W == 87) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 2276736)

PIT<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W == 62) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 1257458)

WSN<-combinedinfo %>% 
  filter(W == 55) %>% 
  filter(`2022 Att` == 2026401)

2022 attendance dataframe

twentytwoAtt<- attendance %>% 
  arrange(desc('2022 Att')) %>% 
  select(Tm, `2022 Att`)

bar/line chart - Need to ask if the text and colors is too much

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=attendance, aes(x=reorder(Tm, `2022 Att`), weight= `2022 Att`), fill = "light grey") +
  geom_bar(data=CLE, aes(x=reorder(Tm, `2022 Att`), weight= `2022 Att`), fill="#00385D") +
  geom_bar(data=HOU, aes(x=reorder(Tm, `2022 Att`), weight= `2022 Att`), fill="#EB6E1F") +
  geom_bar(data=PHI, aes(x=reorder(Tm, `2022 Att`), weight= `2022 Att`), fill="#E81828") +
  geom_text(aes(x=25, y=3360000, label="Houston won the world series"), color="black") +
  geom_text(aes(x=15, y=3050000, label="Philly made it to the world series"), color="black") +
  geom_text(aes(x=6, y=2400000, label="Cleveland won 92 games and finished 7th overall"), color="black") +
  geom_text(aes(x=20, y=2850000, label="<<League Average Attendance"), color="blue") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 2151889, color="blue")+ 
  scale_y_continuous(labels=comma)+
  coord_flip()+
  labs(
    x="Team", 
    y="2022 Overall Attendance", 
    title="2022 MLB Average Attendance vs Individual Team Attendance", 
    subtitle="How MLB an teams 2022 season attendance compares to the league average.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | By Tenley Wright"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 17, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 12), 
    axis.text.y=element_text(size = 8),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=14), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 




note: rays made the postseason (ALDS) yet placed 3rd to last in season attendance in 2022
scatterplot

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(data=combined, aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W)) +
  geom_smooth(data=combined, aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), method="lm", se=FALSE)+
  scale_x_continuous(labels=comma)+
  geom_point(
    data=OAK, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#EFB21E") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=OAK, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=MIA, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#00A3E0") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=MIA, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=LAD, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#005A9C") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=LAD, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-20000, y=W+3, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=CLE, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#E50022") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=CLE, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W+.5, label=Tm))+
    geom_point(
    data=TBR, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#8FBCE6") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=TBR, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-800, y=W-2, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=STL, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#C41E3A") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=STL, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
   geom_point(
    data=HOU, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#EB6E1F") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=HOU, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`+409, y=W+1, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=PHI, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#E81828") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=PHI, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=WSN, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W), 
    color= "#AB0003") + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=WSN, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W+2, label=Tm))+
labs(
    x="Attendance", 
    y="Wins", 
    title="The impact of Attendance on Performace in MLB", 
    subtitle="Attendance had little effect on a teams ability to win games.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | By Tenley Wright"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 12), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=15), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'





notes: We know that a straight line across means there is no pattern/correlation -CLE was 6th to last in Attendance, yet finished ranked 7th in 2022 with 92 wins. Tampa Bay wasn’t far behind them on attendance or wins either. They finished third to last in attendance with an average of 13,927 fans per game.
Tropicana Field is currently the smallest baseball stadium, with a capacity of only 25,000 since 2019. The ballpark is located in St. Petersburg, Florida, and is home to the Tampa Bay Rays. The ballpark opened in 1990 and, technically, could hold 42,735 people. They reduced the stadium’s capacity in 2019 when they decided to tarp off the upper decks. Yikes.
bubble chart

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=combinedinfo, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`), 
    color="#5c5c5c", 
    alpha=.3) + 
  scale_x_continuous(labels=comma)+
  scale_size_continuous(labels=comma)+
  geom_point(
  data=OAK, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`), 
    color= "#EFB21E",
     alpha=.3) +
  geom_text_repel(
  data=OAK, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=MIA, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`), 
    color= "#00A3E0",
    alpha=.3) +
  geom_text_repel(
  data=MIA, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=LAD, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`), 
    color= "#005A9C",
       alpha=.29) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=LAD, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-20000, y=W+3, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=CLE, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#E50022",
     alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=CLE, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W+.5, label=Tm))+
    geom_point(
    data=TBR, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#8FBCE6",
     alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=TBR, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-800, y=W-2, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=STL, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`), 
    color= "#C41E3A",
     alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=STL, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, label=Tm))+
   geom_point(
    data=HOU, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#EB6E1F",
     alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=HOU, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-500, y=W+2, label=Tm))+
     geom_point(
    data=PHI, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#E81828",
    alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=PHI, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-50000, y=W+.5, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=PIT, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#FDB827",
    alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=PIT, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W-.5, label=Tm))+
  geom_point(
    data=WSN, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`, y=W, size= `Est. Payroll`),
    color= "#AB0003",
    alpha=.3) + 
  geom_text_repel(
  data=WSN, 
    aes(x=`2022 Att`-50000, y=W+2, label=Tm))+
  labs(
    x="Season Attendance", 
    y="Wins", 
    title="The impact of Payroll on Attendance and Performance", 
    subtitle="In 2022, teams with a higher payroll were winning more and drawing more fans to their games.", 
    caption="Source: Baseball Reference | By Tenley Wright"
    ) +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 14), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=12), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    legend.position="right"
    ) 




notes chart 1: bar chart of season total attendance - geom hline of league avg attendance.
chart 2: scatterplot with avg attendance on x axis and number of wins on y axis
Chart 3: bubble chart. are payroll and attendance correlated? the size of the bubble is the number of all stars a team has OR bubble chart with Attendance and wins, with payroll as the size of the bubble. Is this too close to the scatterplot?
Add coloration calculation to text, calculate the p value or whatever it’s called
400-600 words for blog text
